meanings.definition: To sever or interrupt the connection of something
meanings.sent1: I had to disconnect the old printer before installing the new one.
meanings.sent2: When you finish charging your phone, remember to disconnect the charger.
meanings.sent3: It was like a magic trick when I could disconnect the wires without touching them.
meanings.sent4: The storm caused the power lines to disconnect, leaving the town in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to disconnect the bomb to save the city.

meanings.sent1: Please disconnect the hose from the faucet after watering the plants.
meanings.sent2: It's important to disconnect the power source before repairing any electronic device.
meanings.sent3: I had to disconnect the toy train cars to fit them back in the box.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut had to disconnect from the space station before returning to Earth.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge had to disconnect from the mainland due to safety concerns.

meanings.definition: A lack of connection or communication between things or people
meanings.sent1: There was a disconnect between what he said and what he did.
meanings.sent2: The disconnect between the two departments led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit highlighted the humorous disconnect between generations.
meanings.sent4: The disconnect in the phone line caused the call to drop unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The lack of internet connection created a disconnect in the virtual meeting.
